answers.answer: Sometimes it's necessary for baby's health or mom's health...or both
Some bc of gestational diabetes or having it prior,nd other complications nd i think it also depends on their dr.
Because some woman may need it baby is not growing and or other problems. U don't have to have a c section to be induced. Or some woman are in so much pain and I guess their dr lets them.

I think it really depends on underlying health conditions in the mother previous to conception & complications during the pregnancy; I have a friend being induced at 38 weeks because she is an insulin dependant diabetic and her blood pressure is all over the place.
I am for medical reasons. I met with a perinatologist decided 39 weeks is as long as I should stay pregnant. 39 weeks is considered full term so baby is expected to come out healthy and safe.

I'm getting induced at 37 weeks because I have cholestasis and if they don't get baby out in time then he could get stressed and it could cause health issues that could be very serious. So I think women mostly get induced due to complications

I got induced at 39 weeks because of convenience. I live an hour from the hospital by myself with my boys so if I would have waited to go into labor on my own I wouldn't of had a babysitter for my oldest and no way to get to the hospital

question: Why do women get induced when they haven't passed their due date yet? I understand if you are having a c section but if you're not why the induction?
title: confused on induction
